alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 9:08PM CST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Alabama, including the following areas, Coffee, Dale, Geneva and Houston. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 907 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daleville, Enterprise, Fort Rucker, Geneva, Ozark, Dothan, Hartford, Taylor, Midland City, Level Plains, Slocomb, Samson, Newton, Pinckard, Malvern, Clayhatchee, Grimes, Napier Field, Coffee Springs and Black. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
